summary: RA is a chronic, inflammatory, systemic autoimmune disease that affects about 0.24% of the worldwide population. RA manifests as a progressive destruction of the joints, leukocyte infiltrates, and cartilage destruction and bone erosion. RA is mediated predominantly by CD4+ T cells overexpressing proinflammatory cytokines, particularly in the joints (7).
